content: - Pretty interesting video interview with the famous Brit soldier: "http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/video/2009/apr/10/iraq-war-tim-collins" Bit of bio if you haven't heard of him: quote: Colonel Tim Collins OBE (born Belfast, Northern Ireland, April 1960) is a former colonel in the British Army. He is best known for his role in the Iraq War in 2003, and his inspirational eve-of-battle speech, a copy of which apparently hung in the White House's Oval Office. "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tim_Collins_(British_Army_officer)" The part that surprised me was his assertion about the diminished US view of UK armed forces. I'd never heard that before. Comments? -
quote: Colonel Tim Collins OBE (born Belfast, Northern Ireland, April 1960) is a former colonel in the British Army. He is best known for his role in the Iraq War in 2003, and his inspirational eve-of-battle speech, a copy of which apparently hung in the White House's Oval Office.

I'd never heard that before. Comments? -
title: Ret. Col. Tim Collins thoughts on Iraq

content: First, thanks for the post ... worth the listen. To your question, I also had not heard or read anything to back up his assertion. Since, if I heard correctly, his criticism was directed at the higher levels of command, not lower and mid-level soldiers and leaders, I guess the US criticism would have to come from somewhere around the 3-4 star level ... and one doesn't do that to one's allies. Again, thanks for the post.

content: Everyone knows the General Corps of our nation has been under question since WWII...no question. Iraq just made it a bigger issue.
